description: Examples of nested loop patterns (loops within loops)

expected_output.quantum_code:
<q:loop type="range" var="i" from="1" to="3">
  <q:loop type="range" var="j" from="1" to="3">
    {i} x {j} = {i * j}
  </q:loop>
</q:loop>

<q:loop type="range" var="row" from="0" to="2">
  <q:loop type="range" var="col" from="0" to="2">
    ({row}, {col})
  </q:loop>
</q:loop>

<q:set name="matrix" type="array" value="[[1,2], [3,4], [5,6]]" />
<q:loop type="array" var="row" items="{matrix}">
  <q:loop type="array" var="cell" items="{row}">
    Cell: {cell}
  </q:loop>
</q:loop>
expected_output.runtime_behavior: Outputs: Cell: 1, Cell: 2, Cell: 3, Cell: 4, Cell: 5, Cell: 6

input.natural_language: Loop through teams, then their players

expected_output.quantum_code:
<q:set name="teams" type="array" value="[{'name': 'Red', 'players': ['Alice', 'Bob']}, {'name': 'Blue', 'players': ['Charlie', 'Diana']}]" />
<q:loop type="array" var="team" items="{teams}">
  Team: {team.name}
  <q:loop type="array" var="player" items="{team.players}">
    - {player}
  </q:loop>
</q:loop>
